definition: big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother
head/hair style/the top/end/beginning or end/a stub/remnant/chief/boss/side/aspect/first/leading/classifier for pigs or livestock/CL:個|个[ge4]
nail/to follow closely/to keep at sb (to do sth)/variant of 盯[ding1]
to join things together by fixing them in place at one or more points/to nail/to pin/to staple/to sew on

sentences.english: He hammered a tack into the wall and hung the picture from it.
sentences.chinese: 他把一個大頭釘敲進了牆，並且在上面掛了一幅畫。

sentences.english: The balloon will pop if you put a pin in it.
sentences.chinese: 如果扎進一顆大頭釘，氣球就會突然爆開。

sentences.english: I fixed it with cardboard and tacks.
sentences.chinese: 我用硬紙板和大頭釘把它固定好了。

sentences.english: Joe hammer a tack into the wall to hang a picture.
sentences.chinese: 喬用錘子把一隻大頭釘敲進牆中用來掛一幅畫。

sentences.english: And this getting down to brass tacks ended a long friendship.
sentences.chinese: 這得到了以黃銅大頭釘結束了長期的友誼。

sentences.english: American speech soon changed the words copper bolts into brass tacks.
sentences.chinese: 美國演講很快就換上黃銅大頭釘的話銅螺栓。

sentences.english: The carpet was fastened to the floor with tacks .
sentences.chinese: 地毯被用大頭釘固定在地板上。
